Class ContentServerWccImpl

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.contentServer.internal.wcc.ContentServerWccImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentServer
public class ContentServerWccImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContentServer

Represents a specific instance of a WCC (WebCenter Content) data store.

Method Detail

closeConnection

public void closeConnection()

Closes the connection being used for this repository.

Use the following pattern when interacting with the Content Repository to ensure thread safety and best performance:

ContentServer cs = null; try { ContentServerConnection conn = new [concrete connection class](...); cs = newContentRepository(conn); cs.doSomething(); } finally { if (cs != null){ cs.closeConnection(); } }

See the implementation classes for more specific examples.

Use the following pattern when interacting with the UCM Content Repository to ensure thread safety and best performance:

WebCenterContentServer cr = null; try { IdcContext context = new IdcContext("username", "password"); IdcClientManager manager = new IdcClientManager(); IdcClient client = null; try { client = manager.createClient("client url"); } catch (IdcClientException e) { // do something } WebCenterContentConnection conn = new WebCenterContentConnection(client, context); cr = new WebCenterContentServer(conn); cr.doSomething(); } finally { if (cr != null) { cr.closeConnection(); } }

Specified by:
closeConnection in interface ContentServer
See Also:
to construct ContentServer classes in a more generic manner.

update

public void update(Content content)
Updates the Content in the Content Repository with the process revisionId. Specifically, it gets the Content based on the revisionId of the given ContentMetaData. It then updates the comments of the Content with the essRequestId. In future, this method may update based on all the ContentMetaData fields not just the comments.

Specified by:
update in interface ContentServer
Parameters:
content -

setSignRequired

public void setSignRequired(boolean signRequired)
Description copied from interface: ContentServer
Set this values to indicate whether the request to the Content Server needs to be signed. Setting this to true indicates that request to the Content Server will be trusted.

Specified by:
setSignRequired in interface ContentServer
Parameters:
signRequired - true iff request to the content server are to be signed.
